references.paper_title: Identification of causal effects using instrumental variables
references.reason: This paper lays the groundwork for instrumental variable methods, which are crucial for causal inference in settings with unobserved confounding, a core topic of the current paper.
This book is a foundational text for causal inference, establishing the theoretical basis for many of the concepts and methods used in the current paper, including causal diagrams and do-calculus.

references.paper_title: Identifying causal effects with proxy variables of an unmeasured confounder
references.reason: This paper introduces proximal causal inference, a key method used in the current paper to handle unobserved confounders by leveraging proxies from text data.

references.paper_title: An introduction to proximal causal learning
references.reason: This paper provides a more accessible overview of proximal causal inference, including extensions and practical considerations which are critical to the text-based application developed in the current paper.

This paper establishes the effectiveness of large language models (LLMs) in zero-shot settings, which is crucial for the current paper's approach of using LLMs to generate proxies without requiring supervised labels for the unobserved confounder.
